meanings.definition: In a murky manner; darkly or dimly.
meanings.sent1: The room was lit murkly by a single candle.
meanings.sent2: She peered murkly into the dense fog, trying to make out shapes.
meanings.sent3: The detective stumbled murkly through the poorly lit alley, searching for clues.
meanings.sent4: His memories of that night were murkly shrouded in mystery.
meanings.sent5: The old house loomed murkly in the distance, casting a shadow over the town.

meanings.definition: Covered or filled with murk; dark, gloomy, or obscure.
meanings.sent1: The murkly forest was a spooky place to explore.
meanings.sent2: The basement was so murkly that she could barely see her hand in front of her face.
meanings.sent3: The murkly sky threatened rain as the hikers trudged along the muddy trail.
meanings.sent4: His murkly thoughts clouded his judgment, making it hard to see clearly.
meanings.sent5: The murkly water of the swamp concealed all manner of creatures lurking below the surface.
